item.title: Personal blog & website using Hugo
item.description:
For some time now, I’ve been considering starting a blog to share my thoughts and projects with the world. Initially, my personal website was a simple online CV, built with plain HTML and Bootstrap, and hosted on AWS S3.

After exploring my options, I searched for a static site generator that would allow me to publish blog posts using Markdown. This approach seemed perfect since I was already familiar with Markdown. This search led me to Jekyll. The learning curve with Jekyll was minimal, and setting up the website on GitHub Pages was straightforward. However, I eventually got caught up in other projects and life, and never managed to complete the blog.

item.title: About
item.description:
Welcome to my personal website, where I plan to share stories, thoughts, lessons, and experiments from my professional and personal experiences.

I am a seasoned engineering leader and software engineer with a passion for solving complex problems. My expertise lies in the domain of data engineering & massively distributed systems.

Apart from technology, my other interests are art, photography and motorsports (F1).




Disclaimer: Posts on this blog are my own views, not my employer’s.
